New Records: Czech Republic vs Turkey match set a record with 16 yellow cards and two red cards, the most disciplined match in Euro 2024 history.
Hakan Calhanoglu scored his first European Championship goal in the match.
Key Match Events: Antonin Barak received a controversial red card after two yellow cards within nine minutes.
Tomáš Souček scored an equalizer for Czech Republic after a defensive error.
Cenk Tosun scored a late winner for Turkey in stoppage time.
Post-Match Reflections: Turkey's coach praised the team's resilience after the match.
Czech Republic's elimination ended their journey in the tournament.
The match highlighted Turkey's ability to progress despite being a third-placed team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was Turkey's first knockout stage win since 2008.
The match was intense and highly competitive with multiple disciplinary incidents.
